tuv.seg: Sending a body from Ireland for burial or cremation abroad
Seoladh corp as Éirinn le haghaidh adhlactha nó créamtha thar lear
When someone from another country dies in Ireland there are certain formalities that must be followed before the body can be sent out of Ireland for burial or cremation elsewhere
Nuair a faigheann náisiúnaí ó thír eile bás in Éirinn tá coinníollacha áirithe a gcaithfear cloí leo sular féidir an corp a sheoladh as Éirinn le haghaidh adhlactha nó créamtha in áit eile
The purpose of the following information is to set out the general process and rules involved
Is é cuspóir na faisnéise seo a leanas an próiseas ginearálta agus na rialacha a bhaineann leis a leagan amach
A funeral director in Ireland can help you deal with the formalities and can make the necessary arrangements for 'repatriation'
Tig le stiúrthóir sochraidí in Éirinn cabhrú leat déileáil leis na foirmiúlachtaí agus leis na socruithe is gá le haghaidh "aisdúichiú"
Assistance is also available from the relevant embassy representing the person's country in Ireland
Bíonn cúnamh ar fáil ón ambasáid chuí a dhéanann ionadaíocht do thír an duine éagtha in Éirinn
If the death occurred on a package holiday in Ireland, the tour operator should be able to help you with arrangements
Má tharla an bás le linn saoire láneagraithe in Éirinn, ba chóir go mbeadh an tionscnóir turas in ann cabhrú leat leis na socruithe
A funeral director from the person's country may also be able to arrange to have the body returned home
B'fhéidir go mbeidh stiúrthóir sochraide ó thír an duine éagtha in ann aistriú an choirp chuig a t(h)ír féin a eagrú
It can be very costly to have a body repatriated from one country to another and you may wish to consider having the body cremated in Ireland and having the ashes sent to the person's country
Tig leis a bheith an-chostasach corp a chur ó thír amháin go tír eile agus b'fhéidir gur mhaith leat corp a chréamadh in Éirinn agus an luaithreach a chur abhaile
Read about cremation in Ireland here
Léigh faoin gcréamadh in Éirinn anseo

When a sudden, unnatural or violent death occurs, there is a legal responsibility on the doctor, Registrar of deaths, funeral director, householder and every person in charge of any institution or premises in which the deceased person was residing at the time of their death to report the death to the coroner

Nuair a tharlaíonn bás go tobann, go mínádúrtha nó le foréigean, bíonn cúram dlíthiúil ar an dochtúir agus ar an gcláraitheoir básanna, ar an stiúrthóir sochraidí, sealbhóir tí agus gach duine a bhfuil cúram institiúide nó áitribh air/uirthi, ina raibh an duine éagtha ag cur faoi ag am a b(h)áis, tuairisc a thabhairt faoin mbás don chróinéir
The appropriate coroner is the coroner for the district where the death occurred
Is é an cróinéir cuí cróinéir na dúiche inar tharla an bás
The death may be reported to a member of the Garda Síochána, not below the rank of sergeant, who will notify the coroner
Is féidir an bás a thuairisc do bhall den Gharda Síochána, os cionn grád sáirsint a chuirfidh fios ar an gcróinéir
However, any person may notify the coroner of the circumstances of a particular death
Tig le duine ar bith, áfach, fios a chur ar an gcróinéir faoi chúinsí bás áirithe
Read more about the coroner in Ireland here
Léigh tuilleadh anseo faoin gcróinéir in Éirinn
The coroner will arrange for the body to be moved to a mortuary facility and for a medical examination (post-mortem) to be carried out to determine the cause of death
Eagróidh an cróinéir seoladh an choirp go háis marbhlainne agus eagróidh sé scrúdú dochtúra (scrúdú iarbháis) chun fáth an bháis a fháil amach
The Garda Síochána will assist the coroner in arranging a formal identification of the body by a family member or a relative
Cuideoidh An Garda Síochána leis an gcróinéir agus é ag socrú go ndéanfaidh ball clainne nó duine muinteartha aithint fhoirmiúil ar an gcorp
Where a person dies from a natural illness or disease for which the deceased was being treated by a doctor within one month of the death, there is no need to notify the coroner
Ní gá fios a chur ar an gcróinéir sa chás go bhfuair an duine éagtha bás de thinneas nó de ghalar nádúrtha agus é/í ag fáil cóireáil dochtúra laistigh de mhí dá b(h)ás
In this case, the doctor will issue the medical certificate of the cause of death (Death Notification Form)
Sa chás seo, eiseoidh an dochtúir teastas dochtúra i leith an bháis (Foirm Fógra Báis)
When someone dies in Ireland the death must be registered as soon as possible
Nuair a fhaigheann duine bás in Éirinn ní mór an bás a chlárú chomh luath agus is féidir
Where the doctor issues the Death Notification Form, the death can then be registered and a death certificate can be obtained from the local Registrar of births, marriages and deaths
Nuair a eisíonn an dochtúir Foirm Fógra Báis, is féidir an bás a chlárú agus deimhniú báis a fháil ó bhrainse áitiúil an Chláraitheora do Bhreitheanna, Póstaí agus Básanna
A death is automatically registered where a post-mortem is held at the request of the coroner however, there is likely to be a delay in getting a death certificate
Nuair a thionóltar scrúdú iarbháis ar iarratas an chróinéara, cláraítear bás go huathoibríoch, mar sin féin d'fhéadfadh moill a bheith ann maidir le deimhniú báis a fháil
Find out more about registering a death here
Faigh tuilleadh eolais ar chonas bás a chlárú anseo
Preparing the body for shipment home
An corp a réiteach lena sheoladh abhaile
The funeral director you appoint in Ireland can embalm and prepare the body for repatriation on funeral director's premises
Tig leis an stiúrthóir sochraidí a cheapann tú in Éirinn an corp a chumhrú agus an marbhán a ullmhú le haghaidh aisdúichithe ar áitreabh an stiúrthóra sochraidí
Embalming helps preserve the body
Cuidíonn cumhrú leis an gcorp a chaomhnú
If a post-mortem has being held, the funeral director can obtain the release of the body from the coroner so that it can be prepared
Má bhí scrúdú iarbháis ann tig leis an stiúrthóir sochraidí an corp a fháil thar n-ais ón gcróinéir le go ndéantar é a réiteach
It is necessary to have the body formally identified
Is gá corp a aithint go foirmiúil
This can be carried out by a travelling companion or business colleague of the deceased
Tig le compánach taistil an duine éagtha nó comhghleacaí gnó dá c(h)uid é seo a dhéanamh
In some cases however, it may be necessary for a family member to travel to confirm the identification
Mar sin féin, i gcásanna áirithe beidh ar bhall clainne teacht agus an aithint a dheimhniú

International regulations (Article 3 of the League of Nations International Regulations concerning the conveyance of corpses, 1937 and the Council of Europe Agreement on the Transfer of Corpses 1973) require all coffins crossing international frontiers to be zinc or lead lined and sealed

De réir rialacha idirnáisiúnta (Alt 3 de Rialacha Idirnáisiúnta Chonradh na Náisiún maidir le hiompar marbhán, 1937 agus Comhaontas Comhairle na hEorpa ar Aistriú Marbhán 1973) ní foláir gach cónra a thrasnaíonn teorainneacha idirnáisiúnta a bheith líneáilte le sinc nó luaidhe agus séalaithe
These coffins are not suitable for cremation and either the lining has to be removed or another coffin provided in the country of destination, if the body is to be cremated
Níl na cónraí seo oiriúnach don chréamadh agus ní mór an líneáil a bhaint, nó cónra eile a sholáthar i dtír an chinn scríbe, má tá an corp le créamadh
Before a body can be removed from Ireland you require the following documentation:
Sula n-aistrítear corp ó Éirinn caithfidh tú an doiciméadú seo a leanas a bheith agat
• Coroner's Removal Order/Non-infectious Note
• Ordú Aistrithe an Chróinéara /Nóta Neamh-Thógálach
• Passport or Identity Card
• Pas nó Cárta Aitheantais
• Notarisation or apostilling of documents (where applicable)
• Dearbhú nótaire nó dearbhú oifigiúil eile doiciméad (más fóirsteanach)
Your funeral director can obtain the Removal Order from the coroner and the death certificate from the Registrar (if available)
Is féidir leis an stiúrthóir sochraidí Ordú Aistrithe a fháil ón gcróinéir agus an teastas báis ón gcláraitheoir (má tá sé ar fáil)
You need to find out from the embassy what formalities and documentation are required
Ní mór duit a fháil amach ón ambasáid cad iad na foirmiúlachtaí agus an doiciméadú atá riachtanach
Your funeral director can liase with the embassy on any formalities that need to be carried out and in obtaining the required documentation
Tig leis an stiúrthóir sochraidí teagmháil a dhéanamh leis an ambasáid faoi na foirmiúlachtaí is gá a chur i gcrích agus chun an doiciméadú cuí a fháil
You need to make travel arrangements for the body from Ireland to the deceased's country
Ní mór duit socruithe taistil a dhéanamh chun an corp a iompar ó Éirinn go tír an duine éagtha
Your funeral director can arrange these
Is féidir leis an stiúrthóir sochraidí é seo a dhéanamh
The body can be flown home or it can travel by ferry and over land
Is féidir an corp a thabhairt abhaile ar eitleán nó ar mhuir agus thalamh
While travelling over land is cheaper, it also takes longer
Cé go bhfuil taisteal ar thalamh níos saoire, tógann sé níos mó ama
The embassy should be notified of the travel arrangements so that the authorities in the deceased's country can be informed
Ba chóir na socruithe taistil a chur in iúl don ambasáid ionas gur féidir na húdaráis i dtír an duine éagtha a chur ar an eolas
Your funeral director normally does this
De ghnáth déanann an stiúrthóir sochraidí é seo
You also need a funeral director in the deceased's country who can liase with the relevant authorities there and arrange the removal of the body for burial or cremation when it arrives
Beidh stiúrthóir sochraidí i tír an duine éagtha ag teastáil chun teagmháil a dhéanamh leis na húdaráis chuí ansin d'fhonn an corp a aistriú le haghaidh adhlactha nó créamtha
Repatriation of a deceased person abroad from Ireland can be an expensive process due to factors such as the distance to be travelled and how the body is shipped
Is féidir leis an bpróiseas aisdúichithe thar lear ó Éirinn a bheith costasach mar gheall ar fhad an turais atá le taisteal agus conas a sheoltar an corp
Check whether the person had travel insurance or private medical cover which would help cover the costs
Seiceáil an raibh árachas taistil ag an duine éagtha nó árachas leighis phríobháideach a chuideodh leis na costais a íoc
If the deceased is covered contact the insurance company as soon as possible
Má tá árachas ag an duine éagtha déan teagmháil leis an gcomhlacht árachais chomh luath agus is féidir
Financial assistance with the cost of repatriating a deceased person abroad is not available from the authorities in Ireland, just as it is unavailable from the authorities in many other countries
Ní bhíonn cúnamh airgeadais chun costais a bhaineann le duine éagtha thar lear a aisdúichiú ar fáil ó na húdaráis in Éirinn, sa chaoi chéanna leis an gcleachtas i go leor tíortha eile
